Sentencas: Reduction-oxidation (redox) cycles of Ni-based anodes in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) directly affect the cell performance due to breaking anode three/triple phase boundary (TPB) networks at microscale.
Titulo: Estimation of microscale redox tolerance for Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes via three-dimensional finite element modeling

Sentencas: Furthermore, these microcracks accumulate with the number of redox cycles leading to mechanical damage in the cell as a result of continuous volumetric changes during the inevitable cyclic reduction and oxidation of the nickel oxide and nickel, threatening the service life of SOFC systems.
Titulo: Estimation of microscale redox tolerance for Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes via three-dimensional finite element modeling

Sentencas: Therefore, the redox process needs to be investigated as a phenomenon at microscale to understand and minimize its effects.
Titulo: Estimation of microscale redox tolerance for Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes via three-dimensional finite element modeling

Sentencas: In this regard, we suggest a microscale approach for the redox process of Ni-based SOFC anodes in this study.
Titulo: Estimation of microscale redox tolerance for Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes via three-dimensional finite element modeling

Sentencas: For this purpose, SOFC anode microstructures with different compositions and porosities are synthetically generated by Dream.3D software and me-chanical damages due to the redox cycle are investigated via element deletion through LS-DYNA for the first time in the literature.
Titulo: Estimation of microscale redox tolerance for Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes via three-dimensional finite element modeling

Sentencas: The anodes are characterized by computing the redox tolerance based on the resultant damage and the anode composition showing the highest redox tolerance is determined among the cases considered.(c) 2022 Hydrogen Energy Publications LLC.
Titulo: Estimation of microscale redox tolerance for Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes via three-dimensional finite element modeling
